title: Should I buy 4k TV or 3d TV ? Both 4k and 3d is super costly, so I don't know which one to buy? - Quora

response.answer_text: First of all, 3D was simply an easily defeatable feature of some higher-end sets from 2010 to about 2016, it did not mean that these sets consistently showed a 3D picture. 4K, on the other hand, refers to the set’s resolution (3840x2180). Second of all, at this writing (2019), no TV manufacturer is offering any sets with the 3D feature. If you have any 3D Blu-ray discs, you’ll have to look for used sets or a 3D-capable projector to watch the discs properly. While there isn’t a lot of 4K software out there yet — beyond Ultra HD Blu-ray discs, there’s just a handful of streaming services offering 4K programming — a 4K set is still a prudent investment. If you want to buy a 55″ or larger set, 4K is your only option these days, and you’ll be well positioned to receive 4K programming when it does come on line.
If you have 3d content to watch go for 3d otherwise a 4K tv is enough.
